MILTON.raw_line: âThe Old Manâ, shock of white hair, drives the Roadrunner, locks the tires and spins the wheel. The Roadrunner fishtails, slides sideways AT THEM! The truck's gonna ram the driver's side. At least it wouldI know. The EXPLOSION vaporizes what's left of his face.Where is she?You tell him I'm coming. You got that? I'm coming to get her back. You tell him. Tell him I'm gonna kill every last one of you fuckers. Milton turns on his heels. Walks into the dust and doesn't look back.That'd be great. Tell me, Stillwater Marsh around here?Stillwater Marsh? You know it? Dale, the father, keeps his back to Milton as he speaks.It's important.And what state Should I be in? Dale turns, glares at Milton.And Wolf Deer Run?Mother of all things, that sounds very interesting.staring at her again. An impressed smirk on his face. Suddenly NormaJean steps in front of him.Full moon's three days off.Pretty sure. Hell of a ride out there. Yours?Hers?And would you be gentle?Car trouble? Piper stares. It's the way he said it. Too knowing. Milton glances at the engine.Oh, that's not so bad. I can fix that for you if you like.If you give me a lift.And I'd be much obliged. Milton leans in, flicks something then rises and THUMPS the hood shut with a smile.Shall we?Darlin, my days of bedding a gal ten minutes after I meet her are over.âPreciate the ride, ma'am. Milton crosses toward an old Superman style phone booth.Hey. Frank looks up as a boot catches him under the chin, lifting him off Piper.Want me to roll the window up?No but he'll likely piss blood for a day or two.Hungry? He gestures through the windshield as they pass a âWelcome to Utahâ sign. Beyond, there are lights ahead.You mentioned San Francisco.--My business is in Nevada. Can you get me that far?I'm looking for someone. You hungry or not? Piper considers for a moment, then--Name's Milton. You're Piper, right?Fair enough.Roy.You hoped I was dead. Not the same.Got a problem with that?Back in another life I used to drive a truck through these parts.I'd spend the night here fucking his wife. Suddenly Milton twists around, stares toward the bar.I...nothing I guess. A large breasted waitress, fuckin' hot for a woman in her fifties, approaches with chips and salsa. Eyes Milton.Beer.What is this?You're kidding.Call me Milton.Fine, then bring me a milk. She tosses his card on the table.Tap what?Yeah. Well. I've been distracted.Where are you...?What about your beer?You shut the fuck up! That's it! Piper swings her legs off of the bed. Busboy wasn't prepared and topples backwards to the floor.Thanks. Apparently I shot my wad. Milton stares down into Candy's face. Her whole body QUAKES...CONVULSES. She sucks in breath and opens her eyes.I definitely got their attention.Come on. There are probably more.Yeah, we both want some answers. Milton moves toward the barn as-- The State Troopers walk around the bar. Everyone freezes. The Troopers stare from Piper to Milton, then back to Piper. Recognition.Aw fuck. Milton grabs Piper, places himself between she and the Troopers as they go for their guns.Come on! Milton pulls the 357 and opens fire! The Troopers, emboldened and fearless, stand their ground and shoot back!No! Not that one. He shoves the 357 toward her. Piper snatches it without hesitation, rises and --Have to stop him...No. They weren't. Get in. Milton climbs behind the GTO's wheel.You gotta patch me up. I'll drive. Piper fumes but climbs into the passengers seat.Yes.Yes. Milton floors it! As the GTO fishtails toward the highway--Christ. Piper's attention is still on the dead cops.Both. Piper raises the gun, points it at Milton.Because I'm driving.They took my grand-baby. Took my grand-baby and killed my... He breaks off. Looks away.Sons of bitches killed my daughter. Piper stares. Milton steadies himself.So Yeah. I busted out. And I'm gonna get my grand-baby back. I'm gonna get her back and I'm gonna kill every last one of the fuckers.In the back seat. Now.Now! Piper scrambles into the back seat as Milton watches the cruiser pull up along side him.Shotgun. It's already loaded. Piper digs the shotgun from the duffle and heaves it into the front seat.Have the other one ready. Not the 357. The OLD one.I can't do that.I got something I gotta do first.I didn't have to do it a long time ago!I won't let you do that.This does. The Accountant's eyes widen.Piper! Wait! Milton watches the taillights vanish over a distant ridge. He starts the engine...then hesitates...Someone else.My daughter got mixed up with the son of a bitch right out of college.She knew him. The world was in a fuckin tailspin and King was preaching quiet revolution. He places the shotgun on the dash, grabs the 357.It was four months before she realized âquiet' meant hiding in the basement, cutting the heads off chickens.Voodoo, the occult, not much he wasn't into. When she told him she was leaving, he helped her pack. Gassed up her car. Cooked her a hot meal. Then while she slept he broke her leg in three places with a tire iron.She learned her lessen. Was a good little follower for eighteen months. That's when they met with some witch doctor bullshit artist in Chinatown. It was Chinese New Year so the place was wall to wall slants. She saw her chance, stabbed Jonah in the face with a souvenir corkscrew and vanished into the crowd.I didn't find out about any of this until...until I got locked up. Only two bullets left. He SNAPS the gun shut. Shoves it into his duffle.Only had three bullets to begin...Stay put. I won't be long.Is that right? In a swift move, Milton RATCHETS a shell into the chamber, drops to one knee, aims into the cab.Don't Piper! Let her go. She's a pain in the ass you don't want. Milton still hasn't let go of his shotgun.Isn't that obvious, you sick fuck? I'm here for her. Milton gestures toward the baby.But sacrificing her under the full fuckin moon, that's okay?Your BS don't work on me. You killed my daughter but I won't let you kill my grandbaby.No shithead, it wasn't. I saw the whole damn thing. I saw who you are when no one's lookin'. And I saw what that night cost ya. Jonah's armor cracks a little as Milton faces the others.--What was it three or four days before he showed after killin my little girl? You jerkoffs didn't notice he was walking a little stiff? Milton glances at Skanky Gal and Business Woman.When's the last time he shared a bed with either of you? Before that night, right?You forced my daughter onto her knees, you sonofabitch. And she made you pay for it. Jonah stares at Milton in shock. How does he know?But don't take my word for it. Ask him. Leather Jacket was there. Jonah made him swear not to tell. Jonah lifts a .38 auto from within the baby's blanket and shoots Leather Jacket in the forehead. Piper SCREAMS. The Baby starts CRYING. Jonah shoves the baby into Skanky Gal's arms then swings the gun toward Milton.I'm only gonna make this offer once. Give me my granddaughter and I'll let you liv--Shit! He SLAMS on his brakes.Son of a bitch. Milton snatches the 357, points it out the back glass and opens fire.Hey, dickless.Got ya. Piper nods, crawls toward the windshield, Milton tries to pull her in as --It's still in there. The bullet. I can feel it.Ain't got time to die.I know, baby. I know. Jonah only had about twenty followers. We hurt him good today.Powers. It's all bullshit.I used to know a guy lived out this way. You got one of them portable phones?Do what you gotta do. You get used to the pain. Piper pulls a black bandanna from her pack, there are white skulls on it. She folds it, ties it around Milton's head.Webster, you gonna yank that .44 or just keep stroking it?You heard about my daughter?Then you know why I'm back.You know the pain and suffering ain't the worse part, right? That's what they tell ya, what they want you to believe. But it's all a big fuckin lie. Nosir, worst part's the goddamn video feed. Webster and Piper exchange a glance.It ain't about the fire and brimstone. Ain't about your suffering. It's about the suffering of them you love. Cuz you see it. You see it all. In full goddamn detail. And there ain't nothin you can do about it. Milton chunks a 2x4 into the fire. Sparks SWIRL into the air.Fuckin son-in-law. He looked like one of them tree-huggin piece of shits. Wore sandals. What kind of man wears fuckin sandals?He loved that daughter of mine. Loved that little baby too. He kept fightin long after he should'a been dead. But some people's better at killin than others. Just how they're wired. Milton's finding it harder to speak.Then them sons of bitches turned on my...nosir, physical pain is nothin compared to watching your baby girl...watchin those fuckers...I'm gonna kill'em. I'm gonna kill'em all. And...and then I'll be done. Milton finally goes silent. Piper makes a noise. Involuntary. Tears stream down her cheeks. She's trying not to sob. Webster looks steely. Determined.What are you doing? Piper pops awake, sits up. Already angry.Uh, no. I need your help. If you're still willing. Piper stares for a moment.Black tears of oil?Webster, I need you to stay here.I'm not going alone this time. Piper's coming with me.Give me the fuckin shells. And the gun. Milton snatches both and hands them to Piper. He then quickly places an arm around Webster's shoulders and walks him out of earshot. Piper places the gun and shells in the backseat then stares at the two men. They glance back at her several times. Then Webster nods. Milton returns, slides into the passenger seat.Let's go.He's too old. He'll just slow us down. Get himself killed.That's what Timmy told Lassie isn't it?This ain't gonna be easy, Piper. I need you. That's no lie. But are you sure about this?I ain't your daddy.Shit. Piper sits up, stares.Nothing yet. Not until... The lights come on.We can't stop. Milton mashes the peddle to the floor.It'll work.Too many of them.I'm...I'm sorry I got you into--Get down!Shotgun! Piper shoves the shotgun in his hand. He quickly shoves it out the window and --They're likely scared of you.Now we drive.Stay here. Piper nods. Milton moves toward the jagged rocks in the distance but soon we can make out the flicking light of fire ahead as Milton moves toward a cliff's edge.Get away from her.I shoot you with this, you know what it means. No heaven. No hell. You cease to exist.You can't stop me.Don't hurt her. Th-Thank you.I'm an old washed up lifer. Never occurred to'em that I was up to no good.What's he gonna do? Not let me back in? Now, I gotta know. Why? Why help me?She don't listen.Then why? Why help me?Then help me, now. There are forty of them down there. You and I could--Then get off my fuckin car.Where...where is she?Keep her safe.I know. That's why I chose you.Webster will look after you both. As long as he can. And he'll keep trying long after he can't.Beat the devil? Nah. Never gonna happen. I'm askin more than I have a right to. I know it. But love her for me, Piper. Love her and make her yours. I don't have any right to ask for your promise...Thank you. And like that. The life fades from his eyes. Piper holds the baby close, SOBS. She looks up at the Accountant. But he is gone.How was that?...But you can't kill a dead man. Milton sits up slowly. Bones CREAK. He holds his hand out. The Accountant takes it. Pulls him to his feet. They turn and walk toward the rising sun. They walk until they are just silhouettes against a bright yellow glow...then... ...they fade into the shimmering heat... ...and they are gone.

PIPER.raw_line: So I tell him, I says, âFrank, that's it. No more free milk. You gonna have to buy the cow you son of a bitch.âWha? No, NormaJean, âbuy the cow.â Marry me? He's got to marry me. I'm sayin I cut him off.Not just yes but hell yes! No tits, no ass. And I told him if I see that big ol' dick of his anywhere near my face I'm gonna bite it in half. Normajean giggles with embarrassment.Well, it's only been two days but that's like a decade in horny fucker years.A diamond? God no. If Frank had money for a diamond I would have jacked his sorry ass ages ago and put this shithole life in the rear view. But he did get down on his knees and ask me to be his bride.Yes way! NormaJean grabs Piper in a great big hug.Did...did you just throw scrambled eggs at us?Hi guys, I'm Piper. Can I bring you something to drink?âShe's a Brickhouseâ breakfast. Ten monster flapjacks for 4.99.Five waters. And what can I get for... Father averts his eyes. He's embarrassed.Oh. Of course. Coming right up. Piper shoots Milton a look as she crosses to the kitchen. Milton rises slightly. He's clearly trying to get Mary's attention. She's ignoring him. Piper calls through the window to Fat Lou.One brickhouse. She turns and stops suddenly. Stares at a pile of muffins kept fresh within a glass cake stand.And three milks.--On the house. She winks and moves away...eyeing the kitchen window. She doesn't notice...Jesus Lou, back the fuck off.Oh relax. We gotta toss them muffins out today anyway. She sidesteps him, exits the kitchen.Get your hand off of me! His fat fingers tighten around her shoulder.I told you, you fat fuck son of a bitch, never to touch me again! His nose seeps blood.Shut up. She takes a step backwards, but keeps her hand clamped to his nuts. He has no choice but follow. She pulls him up to the American Indian family.Tell'em.Tell them...the muffins...are on the house.I'm sorry your kids had to see that. Put some honey butter on those bran muffins and they taste an awful lot better. Piper turns and crosses toward the door. NormaJean is pale as she watches her go. Piper brushes past Milton's booth. His cup is there but Milton is gone.I would. Thank you.I'm only going as far as Blackfoot Falls. The truckstop there.Get it straight old man. I ain't sleeping with you. Milton chuckles.Yeah. Well, that's good to hear.Don't. It shuts Mona up. Piper storms back toward the room.What was that? I didn't catch that last word.I'm warning you, Frank. Don't come near me.Pervert. Piper stomps across the lot as Frank exits, calls to her.I'll go to San Francisco and stay with my cousin.Your car?! Who's been making the payments you out of work, skanky Mona fucking piece of shit?! She drops the gym bag and launches into him. A blur of FISTS and CLAWS. The tears flow. Heartbreak, anger, humiliation. Frank stumble backwards. Tries to block the blows. WHAM!Frank. Sweetie. I'm gonna tell everybody what I caught you doing with my pink dildo. Her laughter becomes a hysterical fit.Go to hell. Frank raises his fist into the air. Then...You didn't kill him did you?Thanks for that.Utah?Appreciate what you done for me back there but I ain't takin you all the way to--What business?Yeah. I could eat.You try to kill me and dump me in the desert I'll cut your nuts off.What was that all about?And you'd spend the night here?What's wrong?Same. Candy plops two pens and index cards on the table.Guess it's been awhile since you drove that truck through here.You gonna tap that?Jeez, Milton, how long's it been? Sounds like you used to stick it in anything with a crack.Suit yourself. But nobody reaches the end and says, âWish I hadn't fucked so much.â Milton's gaze returns to Candy. Even a man as driven as he needs a reboot sometimes. Candy catches his look, smiles. Piper slides from the booth.I'm gonna do my nails, take a hot bath and sleep in a warm bed.You drink it. See you at dawn. But she walks right passed the âMotel Guestsâ door and approaches the Busboy, who's already eyeing her. As she does, our focus settles on a shadowy area at the back of the bar. JONAH KING steps into the light. Ruggedly good looking. He wears a necklace with something bulky hidden beneath his shirt. There's an old scar under his left eye but a scar on this guy simply adds to his fuckabilty factor. He glances at Milton then --Well, I don't know, baby. Depends on how well you do those nails. Now pay attention. You might need to redo that one. He hunches over and gets back to work. As Piper ties her hair up with a pink bandanna. Candy's SEX SCREAMS are starting to annoy the fuck out of her. She twists around with frustration and POUNDS the wall.Shut the fuck up in there! Milton twist and POUNDS the wall right back.Oh! Sorry, I didn't mean... She stops. Stares. Movement. Someone stepped quickly away from the window.Imbecile.Aw, hell. Milton, in pants, pulls his shirt on, rolls Man with Shotgun's face with his boot. Reloads the 357.What. The fuck? You know these people? Milton flings his duffle over his shoulder.Milton, I'm serious! I want some answers!No! The Troopers keep FIRING! Piper stares down at Milton's open duffle. There's a gun lying within the spilled clothes. An ancient six shooter. We get just a glimpse, but we can tell this isn't just any old gun. There's detailed inscriptions scrawled into the metal. The steel of it is thick, tarnished and somehow angry. She reaches for it.What are you doing?!Milton! Those cops weren't trying to arrest us!I'll drive.They were trying to kill us!They were trying to kill you.Christ is right! They start shooting with no warning?! What are you, a murderer? You escape from prison or something? The GTO tears onto the highway!Well?! Which is it?!What have you gotten me into? I should...I should...Jesus, I just killed a cop! I'm going to prison. Give me one good reason I shouldn't shoot you in the face.You know what I mean!The little girl on the news? The baby girl they're looking for? Milton nods.But the news said the baby's parents were... Piper stops. Milton's eyes glisten. He speaks in a whisper.What? Why?He's not one of the ones who took your granddaughter, is he?Is there anyone not trying to kill you? Milton stares up the road. Piper considers, then --Come on. I'll help you. But we're dealing with that first? She points to his blood soaked shirt.She knew him? She knew Jonah King, the man they think killed... She stops herself.Jonah King was into voodoo? Milton reloads the 357, slowly, methodically.Jesus. She twists her pink bandanna nervously in her hands.Milton. Your daughter was in a cult for two years and you didn't know? Why didn't you help her? Milton grabs the ancient six shooter. It's got real weight. His blood-stained fingers run down the scrolled steel. The gun almost seems alive. Pops the chamber.Not gonna reload?Milton.That's his truck.Milton! Milton rises slowly and takes in the situation. Tattooed Guy comes up fast behind the GTO. We get a good look at him. It's Man with Shovel. Piper's getting out, doesn't see Tattooed Guy until he's grabbed her. Presses the pistol in her ribs.Hey! Let me go, fucker! She goes to fight but Man in Leather Jacket approaches her with an axe. Burly Dude is with him.No!!! Tattooed Guy shoves Piper into the RV.You killed him! You bastard you --Oops.Great. Between now and then. I'm'a fuck you up. He takes a step and swings a punch.Give me the baby and I'll make the pain go away. Suddenly everyone SLAMS into the side of the RV!Jesus, Milton. How? She pulls him close...looks at the back of his head.But how...how are you still alive? He stares back toward the RV. Just a dot on the horizon now.I tried, Milton. I tried to get her back.Fuckin devil worshipers freak me out. They mess with powers that should be left alone. Turns my shit white.No, Milton. It's real. Ghosts, UFOs, bigfoot, that's the bullshit. The Devil and demons? Once those doors are opened you're fucked. Milton rolls his one good eye. Piper turns back to the GTO. Smoke hissing from the engine.What do we do now?Portable phones? You mean a cell phone? Yeah, in my bag.Lemme know if I hurt you.There. That's better. When she moves aside we see she's lined up a skull over his missing eye.Why does everyone keep saying that?Back? Back from where? What. The Fuck. Are you two talking about?!Can you fix it? He leans close, hands caress the engine, searching. Somewhere near a fire CRACKLES. Piper turns.I don't...how is this possible?Lots of daddy's love their daughters, doesn't explain shattering reality.Obviously you got out. Webster glances at Milton for a moment.Fuck are you doing?! Milton stares.Think you were gonna sneak off by yourself?! Go it alone?!Oh. A beat.Well if I'd known that I would have slept in a bed!He's not coming?That's what you told him?Who the fuck is this Timmy and Lassie you two keep talking about?!Just drive the damn car.I never knew him. Momma said he was a drifter.Fuck you if you are. Milton notices something in the rear view.What do we do?Oh shit. They know.Milton, this will never work.No. It won't. Nobody gets away anymore. In fifteen minutes there will be choppers, we'll be all over the news... She breaks off. Her mouth drops.Just don't stop.Just keep driving.--They took your granddaughter, Milton, and now these badge-wearing fuckers are trying to stop you. You crawled out of the Goddamn abyss...and a few fat-assed county Mounties are giving you pause? Your grand-baby needs you. Milton nods. Turns back to the road.You know what happens to her if they stop us.You lose the last connection you will ever have to this world. You gotta drive. A scowl crosses his face.No. You don't just drive. Drive angry! Drive with the motherfuckin' rage that'll take us through that motherfuckin' roadblock!Uh...what is that?I don't think...why aren't they following us? Milton slips into his hunting vest. A scowl on his face.Now what?I know why. It's because of those crazy fucks out there isn't it? They figured something out didn't they? Somehow they know how to summon a piece of hell to earth. The Accountant laughs.Yes.Yes.If I kill you, you can't take him.Milton?! He lies on his back several yards away. Piper rushes up, falls beside him. He's alive, mouth filled with blood. She takes his hand.Milton...no... Milton struggles. His head lolls back and forth. Eyes flick around. Searching.I will. Anyone tries to hurt her and I'll kill'em.Milton. This can't...you can't just give up. There's gotta be something we can do to...

At least once a day. It's in the wiring. You did this. You made me cheat on you. You're lucky I'm not more pissed about it. Piper stares for a moment. It's like she's been sucker punched. Then she zips her bag and crosses to the door.Piper! Now cut it out. Enough with the drama!Piper!Baby, Please. Now hold on. Can we talk about this? Piper keeps walking. Never looks back.Piper, stop this! You got nowhere to go and you know it.Whoa. You ain't taking my car. Piper pulls out the keys, twirls them on her finger.I said, you ain't taking my car, bitch. Frank grabs her by the shoulder. Piper spins and --Stop......hitting me!You're insane, you know that? Look what you made me do! She staggers to her feet, sways before him.Come on, I'll get you some ice-- She SPITS blood in his face and SWINGS! He blocks the blow and BACKHANDS her with the force of thunder. She spins and SLAMS into the ground. Doubtful she'll get up this time, then --That's it. He drops on top of her, his fingers curl into a fist.You don't wanna fuck me? Fine. When I'm done nobody's gonna wanna fuck you. Ever.I gotta go. Frank clicks his phone shut, jerks the door open to find -- The Accountant smiling at him.Wha? The Accountant sniffs the air.Sumbitch kicked me in the face. Who are you?The wha? I called the cops, not a bean-counter?Fuck should I know where he went? I woke up and all three were gone.The bitch, the old man and my car!You know what, fuck you. You ain't no cop. I'm done talking. Lifted off the ground his toes drag the floor, Frank SLAMS into the opposite wall and bounces into the dresser.You son of a -- Frank staggers to his feet. Dazed. Mouth bleeding. He wipes blood onto the back of his hand.You...you made me bleed. Frank pulls a baseball bat from behind the dresser.You leave me no choice but to beat you with this Louisville Slugger. Frank takes a step, swings at the Accountant. The Accountant dodges. Bat SMASHES down on the TV. SPARKS & GLASS fly. The Accountant STOMPS on the bat, SNAPS it in two. SLOMO: The short end rips from Frank's hands, knocks him backwards. The piece spins in the air - for a second, hangs there until... The Accountant snatches it, letting his follow-through gather momentum. Frank can only watch as the Accountant -I...what?Wha...what did you do? The Accountant reaches out and twists the bat. Frank SCREAMS out in pain.A â67 GTO! Arrgg! The Accountant turns and walks toward the door. Stops to eye a framed photo of Piper and Frank on the dresser.Hey! Just hold on! The Accountant pivots and flings the barrel of the bat.

ACCOUNTANT.raw_line: You. Fat fuck. Come here. Lou stares.--I called you âfat fuck' and we had better leave it at that unless you'd prefer I call you âdead fat fuck.'I'm looking for someone. An old man. White hair. Five-eleven. The Accountant smells the air, embraces it.He was here earlier. Traveling light. Likely on foot.I'm the Accountant.It will if I add you to the books. And if you don't tell me what I want to know... NormaJean opens her mouth to speak. Shuts it.You had something to say?Yes. We've established that.I'm sure he was. Where did he go? She points.There was an old man, yes?White hair. Angry with attitude.I'm the Accountant.The old man? Where did he go?All three?What kind of car?What kind of car?Your car. What kind is it? Frank stares down at the bat protruding from his shoulder.Answer the question.In there. Trooper #1 moves toward the opened door. The Accountant steps in front of Trooper #2.I'm looking for someone. Five- eleven. White hair. Driving a â67 GTO. He's traveling with her. He hands Trooper #2 the framed photo.Troopers, this is your lucky day. Trooper #2 is watching the hypnotic glinting coin. ANGLE - High looking down on the trio as the coin spins right in front of us - we glimpse the ancient face in the worn silver - Roman maybe?Here. Look at this. They don't see a coin. But a badge. Letters F.B.I. on it.In pursuit of a white haired man. John Milton. He's travelling with the girl in this picture. Trooper #1 fixes his eyes on the photo of Piper & Frank in his partner's hand. Lowers his weapon.--Dead. Yes. I'd say it's unfortunate, but I'd be lying. World won't miss him. Look, troopers. I need your help with my pursuit of this fugitive. If we, we three, can apprehend him...you are ambitious, correct.Wasn't actually a question. I can tell you are. Success will mean promotion. Pay raise. I guarantee it. Now we are going to hunt this Milton, we are going to find the GTO he's driving and when we find him, you will shoot to kill. You understand? Shoot. To. Kill. The Accountant's voice is velvet. Hypnotic. Seductive. Purposeful. Promising glory with a hint of damnation.This man is highly dangerous. He has killed and will kill again. He must be taken down on sight. The time it takes you to follow your protocols is the time it takes him to end your life. The Accountant crosses to the cruiser's back door, the coin disappearing back into his pocket.Shall we?Troopers. Remember why we're here. He walks by them towards the front door of the bar. Both Troopers turn and move around the side of building. Jonah King...stares...stunned, he absentmindedly scratches at the old scar on his face then leaps into the Sedan with the gym bag, engine ROARS to life.It's over, Milton. Stop the car.Really? What makes you think you have a choice?Then you should have done it a long time ago.Milton, I will kill that nice woman in the backseat to get to you.Again. What makes you think you have a choice?Carpenter and despite what you've heard, prefers short hair. Teen #2 sits up suddenly, coughing.Not even close. I won't see you again until... He tilts his head, as if reading a sign too far away....until you're seventy-three. He glances at Teen #1, then --You, I'll see in three months. And with that the Accountant turns and strides away.Scorcher today, huh? He takes a big long swing from an oversized water bottle.Christ on a cracker. My apologies. The Accountant grabs the man by the collar and drags him into the shade of the Station Wagon where he flips him around into a sitting position. Wig's shirt falls open revealing a pentagram tattooed above his left breast.What's that supposed to mean?Pact huh? That's cute. Funny he's never mentioned you. Wig stares down at his mangled legs. The Accountant notices.Yeah, those are fucked. Here, have some water. Wig takes the offered water as Accountant kneels before him.Milton's work I take it?I'm the Accountant. I'm curious. And I never get curious. What do you people want with Milton?Does it matter? Milton. Why is he important to you?Why? Wig stares...searches for an answer. The Accountant snatches a mangled ankle and twists. Wig's body stiffens and he SCREAMS.Color me curious. What DID you do and who DID you take?Need you boys to stand down. Captain, you know what this badge means, right? Not a single gun lowers. All trained at The Accountant. Itching to blow him out of his expensive shoes.Federal Bureau of get the fuck outta my way. You boys have blundered into an on-going Federal case. Now, lower your... He stops, turns...sniffs the air. His focus settles on a YOUNG FACED TROOPER.You. ANGLE - Looking down on The Accountant surrounded by armed angry troopers. He steps from the truck, nudges Cap aside like he wasn't there. Cap can't believe it. Shot continues, moving down, closer and closer until the Accountant is face to face with a Young Faced Trooper. The kid keeps his gun aimed, nervous, excited and confused.It seems you're serving two masters. The kid says nothing stares. Every cop's gun is sighted on the Accountant. He doesn't seem to notice.Take out your phone and call him. Call Jonah King. Tell him the old man is dead. The kid stares until...I think not.All the more reason to keep Ms. Piper in close proximity. You are old, Milton. You might miss again.Stop you? Milton, you wouldn't be here without me, you ungrateful shit. That roadblock back there, that would have stopped you. So I want you to drop that iron God- Killer and say thank you. Milton stares. The Accountant, moves. Quickly. With a crisp flick, suddenly there's a blade at Piper's throat. She GASPS.I said, drop it and thank you. Milton puts up his hand, flings the revolver into the darkness behind him.That's better. He lowers the blade, but keeps Piper close.You're not the first to get out and I doubt you'll be the last but I gotta know, HOW did you get out with the God-Killer?You did not.Wouldn't wanna be you when he finds out.That's cute. You haven't told her?Young Ms. Piper, let you in on a little secret. The Dark Lord? Satan? Beelzebub? Lucifer? Simply the warden of a very large prison. Quiet man, actually. Thoughtful. Well read. I happen to know the idea of sacrificing children in his honor annoys him greatly.Simple. Like the warden, we all have jobs to do. Getting you here makes my job easier. You get what you want, I get what I want.--No.--No. You want to save her then go do it. If you win, I win. If they take you down, I win. He hugs Piper closer.You like butter on your popcorn? It's sure to be a grand show. Piper doesn't know what to say. The Accountant glances back at Milton.You're still here? Milton, the clock is ticking. Midnight approaches.You want to help him.He chose you, you know that. Fast car, spunky attitude. He put your life at risk and you still want to help him?Then go. She rushes toward a goat path leading down to the valley below. Suddenly something catches her eye.Hold on tight. It has quite a kick.Someone else will come...someone else always comes. Piper considers, the SOUNDS of battle rising from below.Piper, he didn't steal that gun to kill me. He stole it to slow me down. He's getting what he wanted. Now, go to him. Before it's too late. Piper turns and scrambles down the goat path.I'm curious. Would you have let him do it? She opens her mouth to speak, says nothing...That's what I thought. He turns and walks away from her.See you. Soon. Skanky bolts. Races off into the darkness.She's here. The Accountant hands the baby to Milton. Milton stares at the tiny face. The big bright eyes. Innocent. Beautiful in every miraculous way. He places her in Piper's arms.I've seen better. Guess she doesn't know you can beat him, slow him, shoot him, even stop him...

JONAH KING.raw_line: It's Roy isn't it? Roy spins from the bar, smiles a friendly smile.Fantastic place you have here. You don't happen to rent it out for parties do you?Oh yes. Tonight, in fact.Shhhh. Don't cry little precious. FF-FFUMP! Two doors shut. Jonah King turns, freezes. Our two State Troopers stand near their parked cruiser, staring from Jonah to the CRYING gym bag. For a cop, this is that one in a life time event. A career maker. News. Media. Leno. Then-- The cruiser's back door opens. The Accountant steps out. He ignores Jonah King and the crying gym bag.Milton, isn't it? Why are you here? Why are you making such a fuss?What's obvious is that you clearly abandoned your daughter.Okay? Milton, your granddaughter is unbelievably blessed. Look around. The world's on fire. Companies own our governments and the people suffer. Daily. And will continue to suffer until change comes. And change will come. Thanks to your granddaughter, Milton. She will open the door to a new world order.Your daughter's death was an accident.Milton, you're embarrassing your--Put the blonde in the RV. Tattooed Guy shoves Piper toward the RV as Skanky and Business woman climb in with the baby. Jonah aims the gun at Milton's face.Let's go.Look at this. He's still coming.The old man. He's alive.Don't you see? We stand at the crossroads! Did you think we would just idly change the world? The forces of evil challenge us! This is wonderful! We show ourselves to be worthy. I'm so very proud of each one of you. Tattoo and Business Woman beam. Skanky pulls her tit out, shoves it in the baby's face. The kid goes quiet as -- The back glass SHATTERS. Everyone ducks!I am patient and forgiving, but that was wrong of you. He turns to her.I'm going to kill you now. And then I'm going to rape your corpse. So that in the afterlife you might consider your sin this day. Piper CRACKS her knuckles.Goodbye, child.Yeah, about that fella who killed all them people at the Bull by the Balls last night. The fella who killed two of your cops. I know where you can find him.It's almost time. Skanky Gal nods. But there is hesitation in her eyes. She's grown attached to the baby. Jonah takes the baby, places her on the stone altar.My brothers and sisters, we have come so far. To this place where the dying earth bleeds its corrupt soul at our feet. From its death, it shall be reborn. As we will be. We who have survived the slings. The arrows. The revulsion of those too weak to believe. We have been cast out. And hunted. But no more. Followers gather, move in unison, dance, writhe, fuck. Tattoo approaches with an old rusty knife. It was probably elegant once. Now it is worthless. He hands it to Jonah. The Followers GASP in holy awe.With this sacrifice, no more will we be shunned. They say the meek will inherit. They LIE. We are not meek. We are chosen. The hounds of perdition will howl at our command. For now we... A HOWLING noise. No. An engine. Distant but thunderous. Heads turn. The sound echoes throughout the ravine then --Kill him! KILL HIM! Followers produce an assortment of firepower and RIDDLE the Nova with lead! Milton sights Jonah, ready to blow him to fuck, catches the reverend while he cocks the pump. JONAH can see Milton's got him. MILTON grits and pulls the 357's trigger: Click. Click.Kill him! Jonah and his men open FIRE!Well...this has all gone to shit. He steadies himself, grips the shotgun and shoves it into the Nova's open driver's side door.You lose.I said get over here! I want him to watch me kill the kid! Skanky doesn't move.
